meanings.definition: A symbol at the beginning of a musical staff indicating the pitch of the notes.
meanings.sent1: The music teacher explained that the clefs at the start of the staff help us know the pitch.
meanings.sent2: In sheet music, the clefs are crucial for understanding the notes' pitch.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student drew smiley faces instead of clefs on the music sheet.
meanings.sent4: The clefs on the staff were like signposts guiding the melody through the music.
meanings.sent5: The golden clefs shimmered on the sheet, beckoning the musician to play the right notes.

meanings.definition: A key or guide to interpreting a map or chart.
meanings.sent1: The legend on the map acted as the clefs, explaining the symbols used.
meanings.sent2: When reading a map, the clefs provide essential information for navigation.
meanings.sent3: The clever explorer used the clefs to uncover hidden treasures on the map.
meanings.sent4: The clefs on the chart were like secret codes unlocking the map's mysteries.
meanings.sent5: The colorful clefs on the chart made it easy to understand the symbols and directions.

meanings.definition: A set of symbols used in writing systems to indicate the pitch of written notes.
meanings.sent1: The composer carefully selected the clefs to convey the right musical tones.
meanings.sent2: In music theory, different clefs represent various pitches in written notes.
meanings.sent3: The playful musician used smiley faces as clefs in the musical composition.
meanings.sent4: The clefs in the score danced across the page, bringing the music to life.
meanings.sent5: The intricate clefs on the sheet music painted a vivid picture of the musical composition.
